paths.name: Status Entry
paths.description: A ticket status entry is descriptive text that documents the current cycle of that ticket.

paths.name: Status Entry Collection
paths.description: A list of ticket status entries.

paths.name: Contact
paths.description: Contact is a PartyRole for a Party that acts as a specific type of contact, such as a billing contact.

paths.name: CMTS
paths.description: A Cable Modem Termination System (CMTS) is a device, usually located in the headend or hubsite, used to provide high speed data services such as cable Internet to cable subscribers.

paths.name: Geometry Collection
paths.description: A geometry collection is a list of geometries, as defined by the GeoJson format.

paths.name: Multi Polygon
paths.description: A multipolygon is a geometry multipolygon object, as defined by the GeoJson format.

paths.name: Polygon
paths.description: A polygon is a geometric polygon object, as defined by the GeoJson format.

paths.name: Multi Line String
paths.description: A multilinestring is a geometry multilinestring object, as defined by the GeoJson format.

paths.name: Line String
paths.description: A linestring is a geometry linestring object, as defined by the GeoJson format.

paths.name: Multi Point
paths.description: A multipoint is a geometry multipoint object, as defined by the GeoJson format.

paths.name: Point
paths.description: A point specifies a particular geometric point, which can include a latitude, longitude, and elevation, as defined by the GeoJson format.

paths.name: Site List
paths.description: A site list is a collection of sites.

paths.name: Order
paths.description: An Order represents an order that would typically originate at an end user.

paths.name: User Credential
paths.description: UserCredential is a combination of user ID and password used to authenticate a user for account management or access to provider services.

paths.name: Bill Charge
paths.description: A BillCharge is a charge or a credit assigned to a customer's account during the billing process.

paths.name: Service Order Item
paths.description: A ServiceOrderItem is a specific item within a ServiceOrder and is expressed in terms of a ServiceSpecification or a Service.

paths.name: Resource Port
paths.description: A port is a type of resource that consists only of physical ports and logical termination points (specifically, TrailTerminationPointSource, TrailTerminationPointSink, and TrailTerminationPointBiDirectional.)

paths.name: EPL Product
paths.description: A Product for Ethernet Private Line (EPL). EPL provides a point-to-point ethernet virtual connection (EVC) between a pair of dedicated user network interfaces (UNIs).

paths.name: Fax Number
paths.description: FaxNumber is the fax number to use when contacting a given PartyRole. It is a type of ContactMedium.

paths.name: Product OrderItem
paths.description: An OrderItem is one item in an order and is expressed in terms of a Product Offering or a Product.

paths.name: Customer BillSpec
paths.description: A CustomerBillSpec is a detailed description of a customer's bill structure.

paths.name: Ticket AssignedGroup
paths.description: A Ticket-AssignedGroup is a group assigned to a Ticket, such as a particular organization (e.g., Network Services).

paths.name: Service
paths.description: Service defines the Service hierarchy. Services are defined by products: All services are either a CustomerFacingService (visible to a customer) or a ResourceFacingService (not visible to a customer but still supporting a customerâ€™s product).

paths.name: Resource Order
paths.description: A ResourceOrder lists the resources needed to provision the services in a ServiceOrder.

paths.name: Payment Item
paths.description: A PaymentItem is the application of a CustomerPayment.

paths.name: Document
paths.description: A Document refers to a physical document such as a contract, manual, or e-mail.

paths.name: Preference
paths.description: A Preference is a favored interaction in a particular area of control, such as parental restriction or e-mail marketing, for a specific PartyRole, Resource, CustomerAccount, or Service.

paths.name: Service Specification
paths.description: A ServiceSpecification defines the invariant characteristics of a service. It acts as a template that different service instances can be instantiated from.

paths.name: Card
paths.description: A card is a physical container that can be plugged into a Slot, such as a networking card or a memory card.

paths.name: Order Design
paths.description: An OrderDesign is a change to an order from the as-built order.

paths.name: Ticket
paths.description: A Ticket is a record containing the details of a single incident such as an interruption to a service or failure of a resource.

paths.name: Payment Method
paths.description: PaymentMethod is the way in which a customer provides payment, such as by cash, credit, or transfer.

paths.name: Customer
paths.description: A person or organization that buys products and services from the service provider. A Customer is a Party playing a PartyRole.

paths.name: Service Role
paths.description: A ServiceRole defines a Service in terms of a set of roles that characterize the functionality of the Service.

paths.name: EVC Service
paths.description: An EVCService is a point-to-point Ethernet Virtual Connection with no multiplexing and is used as part of an Ethernet Private Line product.

paths.name: Ticket Category
paths.description: A Ticket-Category is a category of tickets.

paths.name: Cable Modem
paths.description: A cable modem is a type of network device primarily used to deliver broadband Internet access in the form of cable Internet.

paths.name: Product Specification
paths.description: A ProductSpecification is a technical blueprint for a set of Products, defining their common portions. It specifies the invariant characteristics of a Product and describes it independently of the current existence of any instance of that Product.

paths.name: Feature Collection
paths.description: A feature collection is a list of features, which are geometries with additional properties, as defined by the GeoJson format. Lists of geometries are geometry collections.

paths.name: User
paths.description: A user is a single person or organization that uses products and services. User is a type of PartyRole.

paths.name: User Group
paths.description: UserGroup is a collection of users. It is a type of PartyRole and can be used independently of the User entity.

paths.name: Individual
paths.description: An Individual is a single person. Individual is a type of Party.

paths.name: Organization
paths.description: An Organization is a group of people identified by shared interests or purpose, such as a business or a department within a business. Organization is a type of Party.

paths.name: Postal Contact
paths.description: PostalContact is the postal information to use when contacting a given PartyRole. It is a type of ContactMedium.

paths.name: Device
paths.description: A device is any piece of equipment that provides functionality or is used to access services from the provider (for example, mobile phone, tablet, or gateway).

paths.name: EVC Product
paths.description: A Product for an Ethernet Virtual Connection (EVC). EVC is an association between two or more user network interfaces that identifies a point-to-point or multipoint-to-multipoint path within the service provider network. Each endpoint of an EVC is defined as a user-to-network interface (UNI). There are three types of EVCs: point-to-point, multipoint and rooted EVCs.

paths.name: UNI Product
paths.description: A Product for a User Network Interface (UNI). UNI serves as the point of demarcation that specifies where the service provider's (operator's) responsibility ends and the customer's responsibility begins. The UNI defines the means for the subscriber and the service provider to agree on which Ethernet service(s) will be offered and the characteristics of this service.

paths.name: Site
paths.description: A site is a location where either a customer is receiving service or service is being provided. It is the point at which service is delivered and is associated with a service address.

paths.name: Service on Site
paths.description: Site services returns a list of services at a specified site.

paths.name: Account
paths.description: Account defines the relationship between the customer and provider with respect to billing, payments, and other financial transactions. The customer account is also used to grant entitlement tokens based on services purchased.

paths.name: Product Configuration
paths.description: ProductConfiguration is the complete set of characteristics associated with a product in the catalog. Specifically, it is the parts of the product that are exposed to the customer and can be referenced during the ordering process. It also informs the requirements for service and resource ordering.

paths.name: UNI ServiceConfiguration
paths.description: UNIConfiguration holds configuration data for a UNIService. Each EthernetServiceConfiguration must be configured via two or more UNIConfigurations.

paths.name: Users Tickets
paths.description: A list of tickets associated with a given User.

paths.name: EVC Service Configuration
paths.description: EVCConfiguration holds configuration data for an EVCService.

paths.name: Property Address
paths.description: A property address describes how to locate a property.

paths.name: Product Price
paths.description: ProductPrice is the actual price paid by a Customer for a purchase or lease of a Product.

paths.name: Customer QuoteItem
paths.description: A price estimate (quote) or presentation for sale (offer) of product offerings to a Party playing the PartyRole of Customer.

paths.name: Property
paths.description: A property is a piece of land with defined legal boundaries.

paths.name: Configuration Data
paths.description: ConfigurationData holds the common properties of all captured configuration data (such as files, strings, and binary data). Other entities specify configuration data such as current, backup, and disaster recovery.

paths.name: Feature
paths.description: A feature is a geometry with additional properties, as defined by the GeoJson format.

paths.name: UNI Service
paths.description: A UNIService is a User Network Interface service used as part of an Ethernet Private Line product.

paths.name: As Built Design
paths.description: A ServiceDesign is the technical specification of the service level being offered by the service provider to the customer.

paths.name: Customer OrderItem
paths.description: A CustomerOrderItem is a specific item within a CustomerOrder and is expressed in terms of a Product Offering or a Product.

paths.name: Payment Plan
paths.description: PaymentPlan defines a plan for customer payment and is associated with a CustomerAccount.

paths.name: System Contact
paths.description: SystemContact is a type of ContactMedium that provides a means of contact for a specific PartyRole that is not defined by other types of ContactMedium; for example, notification by instant message or trouble ticket generation and auto-assignment.

paths.name: Telephone Number
paths.description: TelephoneNumber is the telephone number to use when contacting a given PartyRole. It is a type of ContactMedium.

paths.name: Service Order
paths.description: A ServiceOrder lists the services through which the products in a CustomerOrder are realized.

paths.name: SAT
paths.description: A ServiceOrder/sat (SiteAcceptanceTest) is a service order to perform a SiteAcceptanceTest for end-to-end acceptance testing.

paths.name: Product
paths.description: A Product is the result of a ProductOffering being procured by a Customer or other Party. A Product is realized as one or more Services and/or Resources.

paths.name: Comment Collection
paths.description: Ticket-Comments is a list of entries to the log of a Ticket.

paths.name: Comment
paths.description: A Ticket-Comment is an entry to the log of a Ticket.

paths.name: Watcher Collection
paths.description: A list of watchers for a given ticket.

paths.name: Watcher
paths.description: A ticket watcher is a Party or Parties that have an interest in the lifecycle of a ticket.

paths.name: Modifier Collection
paths.description: A list of parties who modified a given ticket.

paths.name: Modifier
paths.description: A ticket modifier is the Party who last modified a specific ticket.

paths.name: Task Collection
paths.description: A list of tasks for a given ticket.

paths.name: Task
paths.description: A ticket task is a record of a set of actions taken for a ticket. A ticket task can be assigned to a Party.

paths.name: Ticket Contact Collection
paths.description: Ticket-Contacts is the list of contacts for a given ticket.

paths.name: Ticket Contact
paths.description: A Ticket-Contact is a modifier of a specific ticket.

paths.name: Task Location Collection
paths.description: A list of all locations associated with a given ticket.

paths.name: Ticket Location
paths.description: The location of some kind of incident recorded on a ticket, such as a service outage or a the location of a resource.

paths.name: Customer Payment
paths.description: A CustomerPayment is the transfer of money from a Customer for products or services.

paths.name: Customer Quote
paths.description: A CustomerQuote is a price estimate (quote) or a presentation for sale (offer) of product offerings to a PartyRole such as a Customer.

paths.name: Product Offering
paths.description: A ProductOffering is the presentation of one or more ProductSpecifications for sale or lease. A ProductOffering may include a single ProductSpecification or may be a bundling of one or more other ProductOfferings.

paths.name: Service Configuration
paths.description: ServiceConfiguration is the setup data for a service, such as the setup of network / resource components for a customer, or a class of customers of a generic service build. Service configurations can be derived from order details and service specifications.

paths.name: Cable ServiceArea
paths.description: A cable service area is an area served by a cable provider. Typically this area would be that served by one or more nodes in the cable plant.

paths.name: Customer Bill
paths.description: A CustomerBill is the total amount due from a CustomerAccount for all products during a billing period.

paths.name: Ethernet Interface
paths.description: An Ethernet Interface is a physical and logical resource that supports one or more of the 802.3 standards.

paths.name: Email Contact
paths.description: EmailContact is the e-mail address to use when contacting a given PartyRole. An eMailContact is a type of ContactMedium.
